Posts.Content: May 31, 2009 10:35PM Danie wrote: Dear lynt, My brother had lung cancer and I was his care giver at home.  He had the same phlegm problem.   The Doctor had mentioned to me that it was not worth suctioning the phlegm out as it would come back a quick as we take it out.  What he gave my brother was a medication that dries up the phlegm.  There is one that can be taken orally which he took for a couple of days, then he was given an intravenous medication.  The intraveous medication does cause lots of sleepiness though.  One problem with these two med's is that it also dries up the throat, mouth and nasal cavaties, thus being also incomfortable but better than the phlegm billed up.  Besides these medication, I don't think there was any.  I wish you good luck with your journey.  My thoughts and prayers are with you and your Mom. Comfort hugs, Danie
Posts.Title: large amount of phlegm in throat and lungs lynt lynt

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2009 12:23PM Danie wrote: Thank you for your response Becky.  I had a CT scan in June, but there was no mention of this on the results.  I told my onc of this when I went for the CT results and he told me it was probably from the bone disease.  I am going for a PET scan at the end of Nov., so maybe something will show on this.  I have bone mets and is currently in a rib, just above my numbness.  My numbness does sound like the same area as yours and is about 4 inches by 6 inches, but mine is constent I just feel nothing all the time.  It doesn't bother me to much as I don't feel anything, thus numbness is better then pain.  I just wanted to know if it could be something else causing it, so maybe I can get it fix.   Maybe, I'll talk to my GP about it, to see what he will say. Comfort hugs, Danie
Posts.Title: New symptom for my bone mets, Numbness??? Dr. says bone disease. Danie Danie

Posts.Content: Danie wrote: Hello to all, I have developpe a numbness in the left side of my middle back.  It starts from the vetebrae area to the side and its on my left side just below where I was diagnose with rib mets.  My rib is very painfull, but this new symptom of numbness just below it started about 6 month's ago and is a steady numbness feeling.  It feels like when being frozen at the dentist, but it's in my back.  My onc say's it is the bone disease causing this numbness, but I was wondering if it could be something else.  Has anybody else had this numbness symptom for their bone mets??? Comfort hugs, Danie  Dx 6/27/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New symptom for my bone mets, Numbness??? Dr. says bone disease. Danie Danie

Posts.Title: Luv2Travel is an Angel now LuAnnH BonnieVA

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2008 10:04AM Danie wrote: Hello to everyone, Thank you for the comments, they will be helpfull.  I am in a major cancer centre, called Tom Baker Cancer Centre.  Thus, there is many oncologists.  I am trying to call other bc ladies that I now to see how are their oncologist.  I would like to know if we are dealing with the same problems.  I know the onc's are very busy and maybe they just don't have the time.  I would also like to put a complaint, but I am worried that the onc's at the Tom Baker are all very close and having them all mad at me or have the reputation of being a complainer. I do have copies of all my reports.  I started that from the very beginning. I tried to call the patient relations at Tom Baker, but she is on holidays till Feb.19th and nobody is replacing her.  I also tried my surgeon, but he is gone till next week.  I called my GP today for recommendation for a second opinion.  He hasn't called me back yet, but I'm sure he will be helpful.  I am very upset and discouraged.  It makes you feel worthless.  I am a person who would do anything to help another always with a smile, thus I find it very difficult to be treated this way.  Maybe, this is the problem, I'm to nice.  I guess I'm going to have to start to be more agressive, which I find it a shame that this is what cancer is going to change me into.  Thank you for your support, it is nice to be able to let these feelings out. Hugs, Danie
Posts.Title: Steps for second opinion or search for new Onc. Danie awjkej

Posts.Content: Danie wrote: Hello ladies, I would like to have a second opinion regarding my case or maybe even look for a new onc.  Does anybody know what the steps would be for this. Last Friday, I was to receive results from my various scans (bone scan, CT scan, MRI).  First when I got in the office, my onc. mentioned to me that my spine was fine from the MRI, but they had not mentioned anything regarding my ribs.  My ribs was the concern from a previous bone scan showing a hot spot on one of my ribs.  Thus she said "probably no news is good news" and said she would call the radiologist to ask him about the ribs.  I also mentioned to her I had a CT scan results.  Thus she said she would read it later and call me back regarding the scan and MRI rib report, but not to worrie since it is probably nothing.  Then she left and we talked to her nurse a little bit and prepared to leave.  My husband and I were talking about celebrating the good news as we were leaving the office.   I hear my onc. screaming from the hallway to come back saying that I needed a bone biopsy.  Thus we return and she says after reading all 3 reports including the rib ( I guess she had missed it) that I have bone mets.   I was clinically diagnosed with the scans, but they were not 100% sure that it is bone mets, thus a bone biopsy would confirm this.  Then we left the office for a second time, but this time with terrible sadnest.    She called me yesterday to tell me that they could not do a biopsy, since the bone was to small and to much risk in puncturing the lung.  She is sending me for radiation and put me on tamoxifen.  Shortly after talking to her on the phone yesterday, I called her nurse and mentioned that I would like to meet my onc. in person to discuss these issues further and had more questions for her.   Then I made an appointment with her.  Her nurse called me back today to cancel the appointment I made, because my onc. said that there was no need for us to meet again and rescheduled my appointment for in 3 months and that I would have another bone scan at that time.  I feel no support from my onc. and I have lost confidence in her.  I thought that they were there to explane us of what was going on with our health and giving us option to treatments.  I guess this is not the case in my situation.  Does anybody else have the same experiences with their onc.? Anybody from Calgary with a good onc. to recommend? Thx for your inputs, Hugs, Danie  Dx 6/27/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Steps for second opinion or search for new Onc. Danie awjkej

Just press on this tab and it will bring you to my message.  You can reply to this message or sent me a message at home.  It would be my pleasure to chat with you. Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with liver metastasis Krystyna Krystyna

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2009 11:07PM Danie wrote: Hello Krystyna, I am so sorry to hear about your diagnoses.  It is so devasting when learning of this news.  It does take a while, before being able to swallow and digest this news, so give yourself and your family time for this.  I don't have mets to my liver, but I do have bone metastasis.  I do know many ladies with liver mets and that have good QOL and have been living many years with it.  I am also from Calgary.  I am part of a Breast Cancer Stage IV support group if you are interested.  This is very helpful with every aspect of dealing with this disease.  You can PM me for more details or contact the Tom Baker Centre and they will give you some info on it.  If you just have the need to talk, please don't hesitate to PM me, it would be my pleasure to talk with you.  You also need to do your Columbia trip.  A nice trip is just what you need at this time and visiting with your daughter will be a blessing.  The love and caring of family members is so important at moments like these.  Sending you cyber <<>>. Comfort hugs, Danie
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with liver metastasis Krystyna Krystyna

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2009 06:07PM Danie wrote: Your SIL is simply a very selfish person.  What goes around comes around and hope she get what she deserves soon.  You of all people do not deserve this treatment.  Please do not waste your energy on her (she does not deserve it) and try to concentrate on your needs instead.  This will give you to much stress and you have enough stress as it is, so you do not need her stress as well.  Your partner seems to be a very good support for you and you are probably his number one concern right now.  I'm sure he can deal with his sister and when time comes he will deal with her his own way.  My SIL did something similar and I just took my warm fussy feelings away from her and just simply ignore her now.  I really don't think that she deserves my energy as it is way to important to spend it on her. Wishing you lots of peace. Comfort hugs, Danie

Posts.Title: Stephanie is an Angel 2timer Britt

Posts.Content: Danie wrote: Hello to all, Haven't posted in ages. I guess it is a good sign in a way :) This one is for my 32 years old son. He was diagnosed in May 2015 with stage 4/ Metastatic Pancreatic cancer. He has been on Folfininox since August 2015. This cocktail has different chemo agents (5-FU, leucovorin,irinotecan and oxaliplatin). The oxaliplatin has given him bad neuropathy, thus having no feelings in his hands and feet. He is now getting injuries from it and very uncomfortable. They did stop the oxaliplatin in January, but the neuropathy keeps on getting worst every week. His oncologist mentioned that it happens that the effect continues even after stopping the drug. She says the other drugs in that cocktail will not cause the neuropathy! My younger brother in 2009 also had metastatic cancer at 41 yrs old, and they had given him lyrica/gabapentin and it had worked great for his neuropathy, but his kind was causing pain not numbness. My son's oncologist doesn't want to give him lyrica has she says it's for pain induce neuropathy and not numbness??? If any of you that has numbness neuropathy, can you please share how you are dealing with this meaning side effects and what are you doing to relive it! Maybe a miracle drug 😉 As for me I am still stable with my bone mets. I'm one of the lucky one's I can say, but now I'm dealing with my son who has metastatic Pancreatic cancer which is so darn difficult. He is also a single Dad with a 15 yrs old daughter with no Mom in the picture 😔. I also lost my brother in 2009 of pancreatic cancer and he was 41 yrs old when he died in my arms. Its such a terrible disease and hate it with a passion... I still come and read the thread on a regular basis :). I took a break from posting a couple of years ago and here I am, back at it! Comfort hugs to all xox Dx 6/27/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Danie wrote: Hello to all, How was your bone mets diagnosed.  I just got diagnosed with bone mets on Friday with various test such as a bone scan, CT scan and an MRI.  I did not get a biopsy, since the rib is to small and there is a high risk of perforating the lung.  Therefore, they have decided not to perform the biopsy and have me have another bone scan in 3 mos.  As for treatment they have given me tamoxifen and I will start radiation.  As for current pain control I am on Tylenol 3 or morphone which doesn't always work. My original bc was diagnosed in June 07 and had a mastectomy with chemo.  I have a constant terrible back pain which started in Oct.07 and this is where this whole bone issue started.  I also have some pain in the bum bone but this one is not necessarily constant and did not create a hot spot on the bone scan. I am curious to see if there is many others that have been diagnosed with bone mets, without a bone biopsy.  Hugs, Danie  Dx 6/27/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How was your bone mets diagnosed Danie awjkej

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2008 08:15PM Danie wrote: Hello ladies, The onc said they can't do the biopsy because the rib bone is to small and there is a high risk to puncturing the lung.  Therefore, they have clinically diagnosed me with bone mets, but can't be 100% sure because of no biopsy.  The thing is that it only showed one spot on the rib in all those scans (bone scan, CT scan, MRI).  It is difficult, since I only have one bone that is affected and who knows maybe it is something else.  The MRI radiologist said that to him it looks like mets, but he can't bet that it is a 100% that.  I'm currently taking tamoxifen and they scheduled me for radiation.  I have constant pain in the back, which wakes me up every night.  This pain has been constant since Oct.07, thus they gave me tylenol 3 and morphone for the pain.  They will be sending me for another bone scan in 3 mos, then maybe there we will see a change. Once again, thank you for all your responses.  They are very helpfull and appreciated. Hugs, Danie
Posts.Title: How was your bone mets diagnosed Danie awjkej

Posts.Content: May 14, 2009 10:50PM Danie wrote: So sorry to hear this devastating news.  I just lost my little brother to Lung cancer on May 3rd.  He also had a painful death, but I he was in my arms on his last breath and he did go with lots of Love.  I feel so sorry for your friend.  I know it seems very difficult, but there is still lots of good on this earth.  It is time for her to do the opposite and take advantage of every minute of this life.  There is still beautiful sunny days and sure she has family and friends around that Love her very much.  You should welcome her to our site here at BCO.  This is a great place for support.  My thoughts and prayers are with her, may she have strenght to go through this ordeal and lots of Love and Peace. Comfort hugs, Danie

Posts.Title: Please pray for Beth (BMDALEY) WingsofHope littletower

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2008 12:07AM Danie wrote: Hi Pam, I just went through a similar situation, with back pain.  I had a bone scan showing activity in a rib.  Then they sent me for a CT scan and MRI.  The CT scan is the one that showed the most detail.  My pain on the rib is constant and I currently take tylenol 3 and morphone for the pain, which does help a bit.  Maybe a CT Scan would put your mind at ease.  These bone scans are very sensitive, thus they can show many things, such as an old fracture, arthritis etc.  Thus it can be just old arthritis.  Hope you get this resolved soon, as the unknown is very stressful.  Be positive.  My thoughts are with you. Danie

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2008 12:12PM Danie wrote: Bubble, So sorry to hear you are in the same boat as I.  What was your treatment once you got diagnosed with the bone mets.  I only have it in one rib for now.  It is rib 6 on the left side.  I also asked them if they could take it out, but they said they couldn't.  How is your health now and when did you get diagnosed. I'm looking at various treatment and wondering if I can get rid of this beast, since it is only in one bone. Thx for your input, Hugs, Danie
Posts.Title: How was your bone mets diagnosed Danie awjkej

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2008 01:26PM Danie wrote: Hello ladies, I asked my onc. for tumor marker test, but she said that we don't do this here at Tom Baker.  Thus, she is sending me for radiation and gave me tamoxifen.  My onc. informed me of all this over the phone.  I wanted to discuss this matter (bone mets and options)further with her in person, thus I called the appointment centre.  Her nurse called me back yesterday and said that we had no need to discuss this matter further and rescheduled my appointment for in 3 months time with another bone scan. I am definitely looking for a second opinion now! Thx for all your comments and support, it is much appreciated. Hugs, Danie
Posts.Title: How was your bone mets diagnosed Danie awjkej
